oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Huey in flight

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A UH-1 "Huey" helicopter in flight over panoramic green cultivated fields, many bright with standing water. Photograph was taken in flight from another helicopter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Helicopters; Aircraft
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Vietnam War, 1961-1975 -- Aerial operations, American; Military helicopters -- United States -- History; UH-1 (Helicopter)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970. A "Huey" helicopter has several distinctive characteristics sush as a rounded nose, a twin-bladed roter, and the distinctive "whomp whomp" sound while in flight.
